modules.description: Moves OCaml values into externally managed memory, providing a handle to manually free them after use. Operates on arbitrary OCaml values, enabling direct control over memory lifecycle. Useful for managing large data structures that would otherwise burden the garbage collector.

Allocates and manages memory outside the OCaml garbage-collected heap using a specified allocator. It supports deep copying of objects into off-heap storage, retrieving references to those objects, and explicitly deleting them. Used for handling large data structures or objects that need deterministic memory management.
